source.context: Redirect both stdout and stderr with clobber
Redirect both stdout and stderr with append
Redirect both stdout and stderr with append and clobber

special_parameter.description: Special parameter: *, @, #, ?, -, $, or !. These have predetermined meaning to the shell

source.context: A name may be the single characters *, @, #, ?, -, $, or !

variable.description: A named parameter whose name begins with a letter or underscore

source.context: A parameter whose name begins with an alphanumeric or underscore is referred to as a variable

positional_parameter.description: A special parameter denoting a positional argument ($1, $2, etc.)

source.context: Positional parameters are special parameters, not variables

parameter.description: A named entity with a value and attributes. Can be a variable (alphanumeric/underscore name), positional parameter ($1, $2, etc.), or special parameter (*, @, #, ?, -, $, !)

source.context: A parameter has a name, a value, and a number of attributes

parameter_assignment.description: A parameter assignment in the form NAME[subscript]=[+=]value, where NAME begins with alphanumeric or underscore. Subscripts are optional and may be nested.

source.context: Parameter assignment including array elements and increment syntax

simple_command.description: A sequence of optional variable assignments followed by blank-separated words, with optional redirections interspersed

repeat.description: Parameter assignments, precommand modifiers, and redirections processed in a unified lexical loop before any command word. All can appear in any order and repeat multiple times.

pipeline.description: Either a simple command, or a sequence of commands separated by | or |&

sublist.description: A single pipeline or sequence of pipelines separated by && or ||

list.description: A sequence of zero or more sublists, each terminated by ;, &, &|, &!, or newline

reserved_word.description: Reserved words recognized by the shell

plain_string.description: Unquoted string: non-whitespace characters excluding shell metacharacters and quotes

source.context: Aliasing - plain string or glob pattern

glob_pattern.description: Glob pattern: plain string containing *, ?, or [...]

source.context: Aliasing - plain string or glob pattern

single_quoted_string.description: Single-quoted string: literal characters, no escapes unless RC_QUOTES

double_quoted_string.description: Double-quoted string: escapes allowed for special chars

quoted_string.description: Any quoted string: single, double, or $'...'

union.description: Modern form: $()
Backtick form
Arithmetic: $[...]

repeat.description: Component of a word: plain string, glob pattern, quoted string, parameter, or command substitution

redirection.description: Redirection with optional file descriptor prefix: [fd] or {var} operator [blank] target

precommand_modifier.description: Modifiers that alter how a command is interpreted

complex_command.description: One of the complex commands: if, for, while, until, repeat, case, select, brace group, time, or conditional

if_statement.description: Conditional statement: if list then list [elif list then list] ... [else list] fi

union.description: Full if/then/elif/else/fi form: if list then list [elif list then list] ... [else list] fi
Brace form: if list { list } [elif list { list }] ... [else { list }]
Short form: if list sublist

for_loop.description: for name ... [in word ...] term do list done

union.description: Standard for loop: for name ... [in word ...] term do list done
C-style arithmetic for loop: for (( expr1 ; expr2 ; expr3 )) do list done
Short form of for loop: for name ... ( word ... ) sublist
Another short form of for loop: for name ... [ in word ... ] term sublist
C-style arithmetic for loop short form: for (( expr1 ; expr2 ; expr3 )) { list } | sublist
Foreach loop (C-shell style): foreach name ... ( word ... ) list end
Standard while loop: while list do list done
Alternative form: while list { list }
Standard until loop: until list do list done
Alternative form: until list { list }
Standard repeat loop: repeat word do list done
Short form: repeat word sublist

case_pattern.description: Pattern for case statement matching (placeholder for now)

union.description: no parenthesis

source.context: Embedded parentheses handling - parens are part of pattern string

union.description: with balanced parenthesis

source.context: Optional INPAR consumption - balanced parentheses as separate tokens

union.description: Standard case statement: case word in [pattern ... ) list (;;|;&|;|) ] ... esac
Alternative brace form: case word { [pattern ... ) list (;;|;&|;|) ] ... }

select_statement.description: select name [in word ... term] do list done

union.description: Standard select statement: select name [in word ... term] do list done
Brace form: select name [in word ... term] { list }
Short form: select name [in word ... term] sublist
Long form: function [ -T ] word ... [ () ] [ term ] { list }
Alternative long form: word ... () [ term ] { list }
Short form: function word ... [ () ] [ term ] sublist

time_command.description: Time a pipeline or print timing statistics: time [pipeline]

union.description: Time a pipeline: time pipeline
Print timing statistics for shell and children: time

comment.description: Comment: # character (third char of histchars, default #) to end of line, not including newline

alias_command.description: alias builtin: define or list aliases
